entry.title: Swap Mouse Buttons on Linux
entry.content:
LinuxMint

Add the following line into ~/.xinitrc before “exec i3”:

xmodmap -e “pointer = 3 2 1”

Ref: https://askubuntu.com/questions/151819/how-do-i-swap-mouse-buttons-to-be-left-handed-from-the-terminal

entry.title: MEAN Devlopment on Linux
entry.content:
ArchLinux

sudo pacman -S nodejs mongodb
sudo systemctl enable mongodb.service
sudo systemctl start mongodb.service
// verify with command "mongo"
sudo npm install -g meanio
sudo npm install -g bower
sudo npm install -g grunt-cli
mean init myApp
cd myApp && npm install
grunt

Now browse http://localhost:3000.

entry.title: Remove Linux From a Windows-Linux Dual-booting Computer
entry.content:
I installed Linux Mint on Thinkpad T440p laptop. Now I need to remove the Linux from this computer.

  1. Download mbrfix.zip from “Download” channel on sysint.no.

  2. Login the Windows on the laptop, unzip mbrfix.zip, copy MbrFix.exe to C drive;

  3. Open a console as administrator, run MbrFix /drive 0 fixmbr /win7 /yes;

  4. Format Linux partition;

Reboot, bingo.

entry.title: Config Environment Variables on Linux
entry.content:
System-wide environment variables

Add global environment variables in file /etc/environment. This file is specifically meant for system-wide environment variable settings. It is not a script file, but rather consists of assignment expressions, one per line:

JAVA_HOME=/usr/lib/jvm/default-java

So do not add “export” before assignments. Variable expansion does not work in this file.

User specific environment variables

Add user level environment variables in file ~/.zshenv. For example, to override system PATH:

export PATH=$HOME/apps/spark-1.0.2-bin-hadoop2/bin:$PATH

User aliases setup

For bash there is a ~/.bash_aliases file, so we define aliases in this file, and load it in zsh with adding following codes into ~/.zshrc:

if [ -f ~/.bash_aliases ]; then
    . ~/.bash_aliases
fi

Some example in ~/.bash_aliases:

alias gst='git status'
alias dn='$HOME/apps/dsnote/donshell.sh'

Refs:

  • EnvironmentVariables on UBUNTU wiki.

  • Zsh on ArchLinux Wiki.

  • What should/shouldn’t go in .zshenv, .zshrc, .zlogin, .zprofile, .zlogout?.

  • What is the correct target for the JAVA_HOME envrionment variable for a Linux OpenJDK debian-based distribution?.

entry.title: Restart WIFI on Mint
entry.content: On i3wm of Linux Mint, sometimes the wifi can’t refresh automatically when available. Use following commands to refresh wifi connection manually: nmcli nm wifi off nmcli nm wifi on
